1.5 Designator classes

pointer-value-address

Open generic function

Summary

Returns a pointer of the same type as a C-typed pointer that points to the object offset into the C-typed pointer.

Signature

pointer-value-address C-typed-pointer #key index => object

Arguments

c-typed-pointer
An instance of <C-statically-typed-pointer>

index
An instance of <integer>.

Values

object
An instance of <object>.

Library

c-ffi

Module

c-ffi

Description

Returns a pointer of the same type as C-typed-pointer that points to the indexth object offset into C-typed-pointer. The following expression is guaranteed to be true:

pointer-value(C-typed-pointer, index: i) 
  = pointer-value (pointer-value-address(C-typed-pointer, index: i))
C FFI and Win 32 Reference - 31 MAR 2000
